html_content:
The Morning

Make sense of the news, every day, with David Leonhardt.

Listen to ‘The Daily’

The inauguration of Joe Biden.

In the ‘At Home’ Newsletter

Ideas for leading a cultured life at home delivered right to your inbox.

On First Full Day, Biden Focuses on the Pandemic

Live

With Plans to Address Crisis, Administration Faces Pressing Challenges

  • President Biden is expected to address a national strategy to confront the coronavirus that promises to harness the powers of the federal government.
  • His team said it had identified 12 “immediate supply shortfalls” in the Trump administration’s pandemic plans. Here’s the latest on the new administration.

Live

4m ago

  • Business Updates

    • New unemployment claims remain high in the latest weekly report.

    • Higher rates signal optimism but may hurt the housing market.

  • Coronavirus Updates

    • One year ago today, America reported its first coronavirus case.

    • ‘It’s such a lottery’: Disappointment and frustration as vaccine offers melt away.

Conceived in Another Era, the U.S. Unemployment System Failed

A decline in funding and changes in the workplace — and how long people are out of work — have left a program unequal to the 21st-century economy.

Biden’s 17 Executive Orders and Other Directives in Detail

The moves aim to strengthen protections for young immigrants, end construction of President Donald Trump’s border wall, end a travel ban and prioritize racial equity.

Charlottesville Inspired Biden to Run. It Has a Message for Him.

The white supremacist rally in 2017 prefigured the rise of right-wing violence. Now, as President Biden calls for unity, residents want accountability first.

Amanda Gorman Captures the Moment, in Verse

The youngest inaugural poet in U.S. history read “The Hill We Climb,” which she finished after the riot at the Capitol.

Bernie Sanders Is Once Again the Star of a Meme

The Vermont senator was cold, but comfortable. The internet noticed.

An Inauguration Defined by Absences, but Defiantly Normal

At President Biden’s made-for-TV swearing-in, rituals of normalcy ran into reminders that these are anything but normal times, James Poniewozik writes.

13,000 School Districts, 13,000 Approaches to Teaching During Covid

To assess how public schools have navigated the pandemic and the impact on students, The Times examined seven representative districts. The answers were strikingly different.

Amid One Pandemic, Students Train for the Next

Researchers have banded together to find safe, virtual ways to teach the principles of microbiology and epidemiology.

Is mask-slipping the new manspreading?

The Three Types of Republicans Donald Trump Created

Never Trumpers, the unlikeliest group of “RINOs” and Trump loyalists are fighting for the future of the party.

From Commander in Chief to Interloper in Palm Beach

If former President Donald Trump intends to live in South Florida full time, he is likely to encounter some friction. (Though his fans are thrilled.)

Members of the Proud Boys, who were among Donald Trump’s staunchest fans, are calling him “a total failure.”

Opinion

Ezra Klein

Democrats, Here’s How to Lose in 2022. And Deserve It.

You don’t get re-elected for things voters don’t know about.

Melinda Wenner Moyer

If You’re Offered a Vaccine, Take It

Even if you think someone else deserves it more than you.

Gail Collins

Swamps R Us

Kara Swisher

A Black and Asian Female V.P. Doesn’t Mean We’ve Escaped Caste

Eric Posner

Why Joe Biden Must Not Shy Away From the Full Power of the Presidency

Jesse Wegman

Biden Can Heal What Trump Broke

Charles M. Blow

Relief, but Lingering Rage

The Editorial Board

Biden Bets on Unity

Ross Douthat

The Biden Opportunity

Steven G. Calabresi and Norman L. Eisen

The Problem With Trump’s Odious Pardon of Steve Bannon

Justin Gillis

What Will Happen to Your Next Home if Builders Get Their Way?

Editors’ Picks

My ‘Long Covid’ Nightmare: Still Sick After 6 Months

A Times reporter caught the coronavirus during the New York City outbreak last April. But the acute phase of the illness was just the beginning.

The Importance of Mentors Right Now

Most mentoring programs have moved online, but some wait lists are long and the rare person-to-person connection is sorely missed.

Lizzie Borden’s Notoriety Is This Home’s Selling Point

The house where her father and stepmother were brutally killed with a hatchet draws thousands of visitors a year. Now it’s for sale.

Advertisement

Continue reading the main story

In Other News

Hours After Inauguration, Federal Agents Use Tear Gas in Portland

Protesters who spent months in the streets in Portland, Ore., over racial injustice and inequality said President Biden’s promised changes “won’t save us.”

A Teenager Went to Play Video Games. He Never Came Home.

Kahlik Grier, 16, was fatally shot in a random encounter in the stairwell of his Bronx apartment building, the police said.

Jen Psaki’s Debut: No Attacks, No Lectures, No Crowd Size Fixation

Ms. Psaki, the new White House press secretary, offered an olive branch to reporters after four years of combativeness from the Trump administration.

The Outfits That Sent a Message

It was impossible to ignore how the new administration used what they wore to tell a story when the eyes of the world were on them, Vanessa Friedman writes.

Suicide Bombing in Baghdad Market Kills at Least 32

Speedskating Coach Gets Over 10 Years in Prison for Rape

A Casino in Manhattan? Strapped Developers Hope So

Trump Pardons Investor Over College Admissions Scandal

Monkey Ranch Owner Charged With Illegal Sales

Advertisement

Continue reading the main story

At Home

The Latest Fashion Trend: Stay Warm and Cozy

My Search for Lost Time in a Slice of Jewish Rye

The Benefits of Moderate Exercise

From ‘Alma’ to ‘Zuri,’ Parents Are Looking for Positive Baby Names

Features

The Raptors Are New to Tampa’s Basketball Scene. The Titans Aren’t.

The N.B.A.’s Toronto Raptors are in the Florida city because of the pandemic, but there’s another pro basketball team in town: the Tampa Bay Titans.

Entrepreneurs Bet Big on Immersive Art Despite Covid-19

For-profit experiential art centers are investing hundreds of millions of dollars in a business where audiences have evaporated because of the pandemic.

Masks Aren’t Going Away, So Consider the Mask Chain

Celebrities have been spotted wearing mask chains, practical accessories that also add flair to a pandemic look.

Best of Late Night: Welcoming a ‘Brand-New Very Old President’

Samantha Bee was relieved to see the Trump years end. “Democrats are in an unimaginable position: We can finally do things that help people,” she joked.

‘Call My Agent!’ Puts a Human Spin on Show Business

The final season of the French comedy arrives on Netflix with a more sympathetic view of the industry than is usually found, Elisabeth Vincentelli writes.

Advertisement

Continue reading the main story

Science & Technology

Tyler Trent’s Living Legacy

Even as he was dying, he worked to raise awareness of pediatric cancer. Now scientists are using his cells to help others.

An Ancient Form of European Money: Bronze Rings, Ribs and Blades

Because the objects had a standardized weight, scientists suggest they were a form of currency used some 3,500 years ago.

To Start a New Habit, Make It Easy

Removing obstacles makes it more likely you’ll achieve a new health goal. The 7-Day Well Challenge will show you how.

New Bat Species With Orangutan Hue Discovered in West Africa

Scientists hope the rare discovery could be a catalyst for conserving the region’s biodiversity.

Advertisement

Continue reading the main story

Most Popular

He Had $300,000 to Spend on the Hudson River Waterfront. Which of These Homes Would You Choose?

After failing to find a suitable place in Manhattan, a first-time buyer crossed the river, so he could at least get a nice view of the city. Here’s what he found.

From Commander in Chief to Interloper in Palm Beach

If former President Donald Trump intends to live in South Florida full time, he is likely to encounter some friction. (Though his fans are thrilled.)

Bernie Sanders Is Once Again the Star of a Meme

The Vermont senator was cold, but comfortable. The internet noticed.

The Trumps Arrive in Florida

Former President Donald J. Trump and the former first lady Melania Trump arrived in Florida after leaving the White House, and skipping the inauguration ceremony.

Play

Spelling Bee

Use 7 letters to make as many words as you can.

The Crossword, Tiles and More

Solve the daily puzzle edited by Will Shortz, or try out other games like the Mini and Vertex.

Here’s the latest on the new administration.Who Attended President Biden's Inauguration? A close look at the masked faces in the crowd.
